hackathon-description-text: During the GODAN Summit 2016 happening September 15-16, 2016, GODAN is hosting the Open Data Maker’s Hackathon, bringing together software and agricultural innovators to create the beginnings of practical solutions that allow for better utilizing, collecting, and/or making more accessible open data to improve our food system.
hackathon-eligibility: In an effort to support young, next generation innovators, this hackathon is intended for current university students and/or entrepreneurs 26 years old and younger.
hackathon-requirements:
The hackathon will aim to answer the following challenge:

We are seeking solutions that must fit into one of the following categories:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Plus copy of Datopolis - The Open Data Board Game
Plus copy of Datopolis - The Open Data Board Game
Plus copy of Datopolis - The Open Data Board Game

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1335 6th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How innovative is the use of open data? Is this simply show and tell, or is there thoughtful analysis and cross referencing, allowing the user to infer multiple sets of data in a relatively new way.

Is the UI attractive or pleasing enough for users to start using the project? I have been pushing users to focus on tech aspect and use open source libraries to build a good looking UI when they have no designer on board.
Is the demo trying to really solve an existing problem or is everything a visualization? Is there the potential for this to have impact in one of the five categories listed.
Building a solution that can be demo’d to judges is the key. It does not need to be fully functional, or even a solid prototype.
Team has demonstrated significant progress during the hackathon event.

hackathon-description-header: Leveraging open data for a more food secure world!
